website_summaries.verdict: This model retains the excellent picture quality and good response time and refresh rates in a screen that is well-sized for use on a desk or similar environment.
pros: Great for both work and game play
Large screen formats offer widescreen formatting, but it does not take up the space of larger screens
Right size for use on a desk or other work space
Flickerless technology reduces eye strain during work or game play
With up to a 144 hertz refresh rate and 4 millisecond response time, model reduces graphics ghosting and lag when being used as a gaming monitor
cons: The sound quality of the speakers is not great, so users may need to purchase external speakers, especially for gaming

customer_reviews.title: Gsync vertical line issue in 2018.....
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor if you get one that works. The one I received still has the Gsync bug from 2016 due to having falty/old firmware on the Gsync module. This is unacceptable as this was supposed to be fixed at least a year ago. Be aware when buying this monitor that the one you receive could have gsync issues.
customer_reviews.author: OverclockerBR

customer_reviews.title: By FAR the best gaming monitor I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: While I've never liked Acer's computers, I've ALWAYS preferred their monitors, and this Acer Predator is no exception. I upgraded from the Acer Predator XG270hu, and I'm thoroughly impressed. The panel is IPS, so angles are not an issues, and the colors are spectacular. I have mine overclocked to 165Hz, and it's a dream. The stand is VERY durable and very tall. Having the option for G-SYNC is amazing. I've recommended this monitor to so many other gamers, many of which have purchased it and fell in love just as I have.
customer_reviews.author: Borsalino A.

customer_reviews.title: Power consumption when in standby
customer_reviews.text: I had to play with settings a bit to get it right, but picture quality is good. The biggest update is the refresh rate. There is a lot of difference between 60Hz and 165Hz. One thing that I discovered by the accident is that even if monitor goes into standby mode - where screen back-light turns off completely and led turns to yellow - even after waiting for couple hours, monitor will always draw around 20W. If will even stay slightly warm even after "resting" for the whole night. I'm turning it OFF with the switch on my power strip, but this annoyance is still here - especially for the guys who leave computers on or just in sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent 1440p gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent monitor. I love that it’s a 1440p 144Hz IPS display. The light bleed or the IPS glow isn’t terrible but when comparing it to a professional monitor, it isn’t great. The left monitor on the photos is this Acer Predator monitor while the one on the right is a professional monitor from ASUS with 100% sRGB. The Predator seems to look washed out compared to the ASUS monitor but it’s possible to calibrate your monitor which I haven’t gotten around to doing. Not only does it look washed out, but it seems to lose image quality. As a work monitor, it’s not too great but it’s amazing for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Salvador

customer_reviews.title: High price but well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is amazing. Worked right out of the box with zero issues. I did not have to adjust any settings. My games look amazing on this. Price is very high but after receiving it and seeing how my games look on it I was very satisfied. Goes perfect with red and black computer set ups. Comes with all the cords you will need. If I had to give it one knock it would be the speakers. They are lame and not needed. Most people use a headset or buy there own speakers. For me though 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Massive improvement over 12 year old LCD
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 12+ year old Dell 1920x1200 panel with this wow, what an upgrade. If you have an Nvidia card and want to use G-Sync, make sure to use that Displayport cable. I run off a gaming laptop which has the mini DP port, which I thought I had the cable, nope I didn't. I will get to experience the buttery smoothness when Amazon delivers that today. Only negative at this point is a single pixel stuck at green. Tried some of the methods to unstick it and no joy. It is far enough over to the side that it does not drive me crazy and is totally unnoticeable when gaming.
customer_reviews.author: jayman

customer_reviews.title: The Pixel Displacement Glitch Strikes Again
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 21 Feb 2019: I have not had the pixel displacement issue in a month. Could be an NVIDIA driver patch has mitigated it. Acer still has not resolved this issue, as of late 2018. They are still shipping monitors from the factory with bad firmware that can only be corrected by you shipping the monitor back to them at your own expense. Obviously they should simply install proper firmware in the first place. This has been a problem for over two years. That reflects poorly on Acer, not just this product. Other issues: the color is way, way off. You have to correct the tint in the monitor OSD and in your video card settings to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The first monitor I've had that has a refresh rate over 60hz, and I hadn't realized what I'd been missing. 1440p is also a great size for 27" as it's not too small to be legible like 4k is at 27". It's also a little easier on my very sensitive eyes as long as I turn the brightness way down from default. I do wish it had HDR and a better color gamut, but out of the box the color accuracy is far better than anything else I've ever had. My one real gripe is that there doesn't seem to be any sharpness setting and it's oddly slightly too low.
customer_reviews.author: Kitt

customer_reviews.title: Everything’s great after day one
customer_reviews.text: Everything is as described. Setting up the monitor was easy, very quality stand, although it is a little awkwardly shaped. Performs very well. Only complaint was that it took some googling to get it off its out of box 60 FPS.144-165 FPS is night and day compared to 60 FPS. No backlight bleed, cables all included. Would definitely recommend if picture quality is important but you are looking for higher FPS. I don’t really like all the gamer settings and stuff, they are pretty dumb. The speakers as expected were pretty bad, but the settings and speakers were not why I bought it. So I am very happy so far after day 1.
customer_reviews.author: Pretty Family

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, if you can get one that works
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these monitors already and they work great. I have attempted twice now to purchase a fully functioning 3rd one but to no avail. The last two monitors I've ordered have had manufacturing flaws (listed below). The first monitor I ordered had a 5-pixel wide vertical section that took those pixels which would have been displayed in the middle of the screen and displayed them all the way on the right side. The Second monitor I ordered had a Dead pixel right out of the box when you're viewing any dark or black images.
customer_reviews.author: Carl C.

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: The "light bleed" issue never arises. If I stare at a black screen in the dark, I can see the bleed but it's not something I ever notice when using it. I love the picture and colors - a real upgrade from my G-SYNC TFT monitor. I have not been able to see any ghosting even though I've been looking for it. G-SYNC works great. Big screen/bright backlight improves FPS scores a bit. I would give it 5 stars, but sometimes the picture gets unaligned on the right half of the screen; I have to turn the monitor off/on to make it go away.
customer_reviews.author: Steave G

customer_reviews.title: This is a gamer's wet dream!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor. Great build quality and heavy as hell. Picture quality is unbelievable, no IPS glow on my monitor. 27" at 1440p is perfect. Happy with this purchase, I don't regret it. Do yourself a favor, if you wake up soaking wet from the best dream ever only to realize it's a dream. Then buy this monitor cause your dreams will become a reality. Oh yeah!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Andrew

customer_reviews.title: In love!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Predator XB27HU1 and for a reason! Although not cheap by any means, these things are build to last and the customer support is top notch! You get your own VIP card/tech support when you get one of these, how fancy is that?! :) Seriously, i am in love with these Predator monitors and am grateful that i am able to own two of these! You will not be dissapointed! PS: IF you would receive one with some backlight bleeding contact Amazon and or Acer they will help you out! Backlight bleed is at times more noticeable with IPS panels yet luckily both my units where nearly perfect so i kept them! :)
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Extremely high quality monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have been stunned since day one at the quality of this monitor. It was cheaper than some of the more high end alternatives, but offered a few of the same features. It's got an awesome refresh rate of 144hz (overclockable to 165hz which I highly recommend doing) the colors are vibrant and sharp, and the blacks are deep and pure. A few weeks ago I was at a friends house when he wanted to show me a video on his computer. It was rough watching a video on an "older" monitor like that. Let me just say that after using the Predator monitor, everything else just seems sub-par.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Dropped pixels! No good!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor for a while now. The picture quality is great. The only problem I have with this is every so often I will get a line down the center, I'm guessing that is dropped pixels. I have to turn the monitor off then turn it back on when it happens, so that gets pretty aggravating. I wouldn’t recommend this item just because of that. Some days I can go without it happening, then some days it will happen one or more times a day.
customer_reviews.author: HarryKaincles

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The back lighting isn't an issue like some of the other reviews complain about. I set my brightness to about 30 or so and it's plenty bright and gives good enough black levels for dark scenes. 2k resolution and 160hz is fantastic, I can't go back to 1080 60hz anymore. The only thing I would change would be the menu buttons and system, using the little nipple controler is a lot easier than the 4 or 5 button system that this monitor uses.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Needs some work.
customer_reviews.text: I had a weird situation honestly, when I first opened this box I was like “what the heck” and shortly after found out why, the wrong monitor was in the package. They replaced it which was cool, but Now after using it for a while. It’s kinda a bad monitor. I’m not happy with it, it has white light bleeding through in a lot of places, everything seems off colored to be honest, not what I was expecting, loved at first but now I have more experience with gaming monitors now and this one is not up to par.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rees

customer_reviews.title: This is my primary gaming
customer_reviews.text: monitor. I was a little hesitant after reading some reviews about some QC issues, but I must say, mine has been superb. The 144 refresh rate along with the g-sync is just outstanding. I've had zero issues, and zero dead pixels in the time I've owned it and it's on approx 12 hours a day. I work from home, when working on the 34" ultrawide this one has a netflix or youtube running on it for white noise and when I complete the days work, it immediately switches to gaming. So it gets a work out daily, and no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Arioc

customer_reviews.title: Acer's 27“ IPS 1440P 165Hz G-Sync is $200 less than Asus's
customer_reviews.text: The Acer 27" LED IPS 1440P 165Hz 4ms G-sync monitor kicks arse. It has a 3 year warranty included in writing which is incorrect in Amazon's product info link. Firmware interface comparable to Asus's comparable 27“ 1440P 144Hz IPS monitor which is $200 more. I upgraded from a Asus 27“ LED IPS 1440P 60Hz monitor. The Acer product has a better stand with left and right turn of axis on the monitor base as well as up and down as well as rotate to portrait and wide screen. My Asus only offers up and down and rotate to portrait and widescreen.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Really nice monitor
customer_reviews.text: I'm someone who reads like 100 reviews for 100 monitors. For some reason I always focus on the bad reviews and can never decide. I took a chance here, even after seeing bad reviews, and hoped the majority were right. They were. Super nice monitor. I play a ton of computer games, and have a great top of the line Alienware PC with it - and it just destroys (in a good way, lol) every game I play. Highly, highly recommended. If you are like me and have trouble deciding - just stop. Buy this monitor. You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Philly

customer_reviews.title: Incredible monitor - you won't want anything less than 144 after this
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Acer Predator Helios 300, and I'm very happy with the purchase. As with any purchase of this size, make sure you understand the limitations and all the details. For example, if you are using HDMI, you're limited to 60 fps. Comes with HDMI > HDMI, DP > DP, but if you have a mini DP output on your PC you'll need your own mini DP to DP cable. The USB connections on the back only work if you have the "USB Upstream" cable plugged in from your computer to the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: It took too long for me to take the plunge and get a monitor that can put my GTX1080 to work! Picture is buttery smooth with G-sync. Good color depth, high adjustability of all picture settings. I like the dark booster, which drastically helps in darker environments in your games. For FPS's, there's a neat reticle/aim point you can display. The only issue I've had after 3 months is that on two occasions, it's taken a column about 4 or 5 pixels wide from dead center and shifted it to the far left side. Very strange. Turning the monitor off and on again fixed it each time. Great gaming monitor overall!
customer_reviews.author: Chris LTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Sweet spot price for a 1440p / 144Hz display. Can't go wrong. Took one star off for a design flaw reason. The plastic frame that the screen sits in has no lip over the screen, it just sits in it with the slightest of opening around the entire screen. I've only had the unit a couple days and already dust and small particulates have started building up around the screen. Probably should take two stars off, but other than that the monitor performs exactly as expected. I have a feeling Acer is discontinuing this model and probably for the reason I gave. Kind of needs a "B" version.
customer_reviews.author: The Artist

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking I wouldn't be able to justify the price and exchange it for a 240hz TN panel. I knew within 25 minutes it was well worth it. The color depth is noticeably better than my old 144hz TN panel. The 165hz is good enough for my eyes in competitive games. 2k res doesn't tax my frame rate much but games look a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Palio

customer_reviews.title: Failing monitor poor support
customer_reviews.text: For a $500 monitor you would expect this thing to last more than 2 years. Well, 1.5 years in, the menu displays just started RADOMLY appearing as if a ghost was pressing the buttons. Had to send it in, and what did they do? "Reseat" the board underneath. It worked for about an hour and then the same issue happened. Sent back, they finally replaced it and the problem resolved. Now 3 months later there's a dead pixel right in the middle of my screen where I'm writing this.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: Good performance but buggy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Thin bezels 2. 144hz refresh rate and G-Sync make a difference Cons: 1. Left half of screen is sometimes offset to the right by around 15 pixels when switching from desktop to game. I'm frequently minimizing a game so it is quite frustrating. I sent it for repair to Acer 20 days ago, repair is still in progress... 2. Menu is not friendly and very confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Xeon[13]

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I returned a CX Oled 55" TV with Gsync 120hz and try this monitor instead, Wow! Just perfect!, Oled gives you eyes strains and motion sickness is very bad but must people don't know because is too new, at least LG tech makes me sick, this monitor is perfect! And finally understood, I don't need more than 27" monitor, it's just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Adan

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, but...
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is decent, gaming it works well, colors look nice, but I dont like hue in windows it’s has an orange tinge to it, whites are not white. I have an Asus ROG PG279 and there is night and day differences between the two. My rog cost a pretty penny though, I am going to keep the monitor it works well for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Lindenmayer

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, in my opinion 27" is the best size given the 1440p resolution. Sitting about 3 feet away from the monitor is just right. I personally don't see the hype in curved or 4k monitors yet, especially since we don't have 4k @60fps. The style of the stand is a bit too "gamer-y" for my taste but I'm planning on replacing the stand with another VESA mount. Overall a great monitor and I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: There's a bunch of mixed reviews about this product everywhere, but it was on sale and is still one of the better monitors to get so I purchased. No issues whatsoever and I'm so glad for that. No dead pixels, no damage, no firmware issues. Just works. Great monitor! Definitely much bigger than I thought it'd be (I had an old 23" monitor I've been using for over 10 years now), and decided this would be my upgrade for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Really bad Backlight bleeding
customer_reviews.text: People who like this monitor have probably never owned a good display. Sure this product has a fast refresh rate that makes games look smooth, but for anything but gaming it’s useless. The backlight bleeding is atrocious. I don’t understand how Acer can think this is acceptable in a product. First pic is the display in a dark room, other pic is this panel compared to another IPS panel.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Gunder

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor after weeks of reviewing. When I received the monitor it worked fine, set it up and was very impressed by the quality. However, after 24 hours is went black and unresponsive. i called acer support line they said it was defective. The return and replacement process went smooth and within a week I should have a replacement. I'm worried that this is a common problem with the monitor and am very disappointed in receiving a faulty monitor. Thus the 2 star review. If the new one comes and there are no problems I might change my review but for now 2 strs. Big let down.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed, bad bad bad backlight bleed!
customer_reviews.text: Was wondering what was going on after freshly plugging this beauty in only to realize it wasn't the reflection of the finish on the monitor. This thing has at LEAST 40% of the screen on either side, depending on your viewing angle, bleeding through. With a black background it looks like I have a gradient going from a decent black all the way to a light gray background. When I get home from work I'll try to take a picture. AVOID
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy

customer_reviews.title: Quality monitor, now my main monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Two USB ports on the side, slim trim around the edges and glorious 144hz gsync on a IPS panel what more could you want. Looks amazing. Immediately blown away by the quality compared to my 1080p 144hz monitor I've been using for years I didn't think the jump up in resolution would be this insane.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Madary Jr

customer_reviews.title: May have a winner here....
customer_reviews.text: So far so good.... Pros: No dead pixels Little to no glow or black light bleed- I may have won the panel lottery? Thin bezels -dual set up would look sick With a few tweaks colors/picture is nice & crisp G-sync 165 hrtz Vesa mount Cons: Expensive Cumbersome OS buttons- be prepared to curse Ticky tacky stand- Vesa mounting solves this issue & looks better imo Expensive
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good option for the price if you get one that works or isn’t defective
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Predator XB1 and the Asus ROG PG279Q for side by side comparison and as a fail safe - lo and behold both of them came with defects, however I decided to return the Acer because it came with a scratch in the middle of the screen!!!!? It’s a great screen overall had it not been for the defect but the reason I decided going with the Asus (which came with unacceptable backlight bleed) is because I can’t STAND the Acer’s menu interface - boils down to personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great IPS, 1440p, 27 inch, G-SYNC, 165hz monitor. No dead pixels or funny lines described in other reviews. Use ICC file and manual settings for Model : Acer Predator XB271HU. First do any manual setup via the controls on the monitor, then load up the ICC/.icm profile. I decided to turn off Game Mode because the monitor was very bright with it on. You will have to spend some time tweaking to get what you want. Firmware version appears to be from June 2019, so this is good.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: check this before you buy
customer_reviews.text: My friend got one of this monitor and he really enjoys it. But the one I received didn’t work. The box and everything inside it look more like used stuff. Maybe they sent me a used one? Anyway, what’s more important is: it didnt work. When I plugged in the DisplayPort cable I got a “no signal”, tried every solution online and no luck. The hdmi cable works but I am not buying this for 60hz monitor right? So I end up have to return this monitor. Later I bought a LG 27gl850 and that one works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Yingbei Tong

customer_reviews.title: Multiple dead/stuck pixels
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed fine out of the box. Withing a few days a group of deal/stuck pixels showed up in the upper right corner of the screen. They are only present when you open up a windows with white leds and its next to the pixels with a darker background. Some show up as green pixels and a couple show up as blue pixels. I also encountered the issue with the left part of my screen showing up on the right side of the monitor in a slim bar. Overall this seems like a buggy piece of hardware that I'm not going to risk replacing in fear that these problems could happen again outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Akers

customer_reviews.title: Would’ve been a great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective unit. There was condensation build up or something in the top right corner. It mostly went away, and I could’ve received a replacement but I didn’t want to ship more boxes during the covid pandemic. 3 weeks into ownership, a dead pixel shows up in the middle of of the display. I will not be purchasing the same monitor again.
customer_reviews.author: Acundo

customer_reviews.title: Works well with VESA mount
customer_reviews.text: I've had this 1440 monitor for a couple of months now and am very impressed with it. It's got many options in the menu and took a little time to understand it all, but it works very well for my computer needs. I run it at the 144Hz and have no complaints, the blue light night mode took a little getting used to but now I don't know how I gamed before on my older ASUS 60Hz monitor.
customer_reviews.author: 1danbo

customer_reviews.title: Game of chance
customer_reviews.text: Lost the pixel lottery with this one. Got 2 patches of purple pixels near the top of the screen. Apparently these are called stuck pixels. Also have the occasional vertical line down the middle of the screen. Hoping I'll get lucky with a replacement. If you get this monitor please run it through some sort of monitor test to make sure it doesn't have any defects like mine does.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Lee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Gaming Monitor at 1440p & 144hz
customer_reviews.text: Amazing upgrade coming form an ultrawide 1080 75hz monitor. Biggest notable improvement for me while gaming is the clarity and sharpness improvement for the games. I can not notice the refresh rate difference as much as every one hypes up but I know there is definitely a benefit to having the extra hz. 100% recommended for people looking to upgrade their gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: JT Garza

customer_reviews.title: Great except it came with 1 dead pixel
customer_reviews.text: Going to contact warranty department about the dead pixel. It's centered on the vertical, but about 3/4 of the way over to the right of the screen so I might not have any luck. Beyond this issue the monitor is very nice. Stand it comes with is the best stand I've ever seen on a monitor. I have had pixel displacement issues twice since I bought this about a month and a half ago, but the problem is resolved by power cycling the monitor, so no big deal. Even with the dead pixel, I consider this a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Shane_Plew

customer_reviews.title: Best Monitor still today!
customer_reviews.text: If you are gamer or a developer this monitor is an excellent choice. I am very picky when purchasing any computer hardware for a new build and this monitor matches perfectly. AMD 3900X, EVGA RTX 2080 Super, SSD, just to name a few. This complete system is blazing fast and having a good monitor just brightens up the day even more.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Guy for Reviews

customer_reviews.title: G-Sync is the best thing to ever happen to PC gaming
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing. So long as you can keep above 45 fps it doesn't matter where the frame jumps, it's silky smooth. Truly marvelous. Aside from that, 1440p is Crystal clear, 165 hz is a welcome addition, and the monitor is a great size. According to rtings the color accuracy is relatively poor out of the box, but luckily you can download a color profile for free from them which puts the monitor at 96% coverage of the srgb color scale. Looks very good!
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted it to be.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this XB271HU for my 14 yr old to use with school work and steam games. Did my research and decided on this one. Running it with a 1080 TI SC2. Huge upgrade from 21 inch 120hz monitor. Looks beautiful and Gsync is a very expensive tech but worth it to me. Not waiting for the more expensive 4k 144hz monitors. Will purchase same combo from amazon again for second gaming pc for son no 2. Set up going to be ready for future games for years to come. Thanks. Mike
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I've had this for about... three hours ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about... three hours now. I guess I won the panel lottery because there are no dead pixels, no weird lines, and I didn't find any need to calibrate the colors. Something worth noting though: If you're using an nvidia card, it might not default to the 144hz resolution setting when you initially hook it up. You need to go in to the nvidia control panel and change your display resolution to the 144hz option. By default it stays at 60hz.
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe T. Jenkinson

customer_reviews.title: Stupidly short  cables
customer_reviews.text: The monitor itself is very nice (144HZ is VERY noticeable) but I can't actually hook it up in a reasonable place at the moment because the monitor is on the desk and the tower is under the desk and the cable Acer included is ridiculously short. I mean, seriously? It's supposed to be a premium product (there's a little booklet included with the monitor even discussing this) and they can't be bothered to include a decent cable. Congrats Acer, for saving that 10c (if even) per unit and pissing off your customers (at least this one). It's a decent product other than that, but that's demonstrating a ridiculous lack of care for your customer's convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is really good. Only issue is with the line of pixels out of whack in the middle of the screen occurring at time as others have described. Very disappointing for such an expensive and otherwise great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gaming monitor and just for browsing too.
customer_reviews.text: I was on a 1080p 60 hz monitor since 2014 and wow this is a huge upgrade. Made my system perform better in games and browsing. My monitor was bottlenecking my PC and now I have room to upgrade. I get abt 60 FPS in games and this is 144hz so I can have room to upgrade and see a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really good monitor for gaming. I got it for the refresh rate and I’ve had this one for a few months. I’ve had another one for almost two years now and haven’t had any problems with it. The picture quality isn’t bad but it’s not the best. I would definitely suggest this monitor for gaming. But if you are looking for strict picture quality, look elsewhere. Still a great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it for his gaming it’s great good quality so far so good the resolution looks great only thing the volume it’s not that loud.
customer_reviews.author: Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Must by for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This monitor looks amazing (predator 27") Picture quality and brightness are on point. There is no backlight bleed. Only complaint I have is that every once in a while the HDMI PS4 seems to create a picture split onscreen. I have to unplug it and plug it back in and it works again. Not the cable because I replaced it twice. It might be a defective input on the monitor. Still an amazing monitor. Will buy another one when I upgrade to 2 monitors
customer_reviews.author: Chunky

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Samsung 4K TV as a monitor and while having a 55" screen was great and all, I wanted better refresh rates. G-sync enabled without any issues at 144hz. No artifacts, stuck pixels, or detectable light bleed. Sound quality is lacking compared to the TV, but I have headphones.
customer_reviews.author: WildBob

customer_reviews.title: Terrible input switching
customer_reviews.text: The panel is great, colors look good and viewing angles are wide. I docked it one star because of the terrible button layout. This monitor has two inputs, but requires pressing 4 different buttons just to swap between them. It should be a toggle! One touch. That plus there is no option for an auto mode.
customer_reviews.author: iDevGuy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in every way!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing all around! No dead pixels, no backlight bleed, no issues or complaints! I've had great luck and experiences with all of my Acer monitors and it's amazing the difference between this and my old K272HUL. Can't wait for the GTX3080 to really utilize the 144hz
customer_reviews.author: Indless

customer_reviews.title: After using a smart TV as a gaming monitor for years, this is like breathing air for the first time.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most beautiful screen I have ever seen in my entire life. It is like I had no idea I was watching YouTube on my HD screen in 240p and someone fixed my settings. Or like I wiped the layer of dust off a painting. Or finally got glasses after years of needing them.
customer_reviews.author: Quarex

customer_reviews.title: Supposedly a great monitor... if you get one that works.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a few reviews for this monitor of people saying they got defective monitors. I saw it on sale and decided to go for it anyway. The first monitor died in a day. The replacement started having really bad image retention (what people sometimes call screen burn, but it's temporary and recurring). At this point I returned the monitor and bought a different one. It is a shame. A friend of mine has this monitor and he has no issues. It's a beautiful monitor when it's working, but it's hard for me to recommend considering my experience and how frequently other people have similar experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from 1080p
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. 27” 1440p is a significant upgrade from my 23” 1080p monitor. My HD home Videos play much better. First upgrade so the rest of the system is trying to hang on. My set up we built over 9 years ago. I run a i5-2500k with a 950ti. The speakers are useless. The monitor looks great. Clean lines. The red pops for those who want an aggressive style for their gaming rig. You won’t be disappointed with this monitor. Worth the cost IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Sony Merus

customer_reviews.title: The Picture is good as a premium product, BUT did has a black screen flicker issue!
customer_reviews.text: The Picture is good as a premium product(Guess that LED panel is not from Acer) , but a ENTIRE screen turn black/flicker BUG is really bothering!!! After sometime of usage, around one year, this issue happens more and more frequently, the black screen duration turns longer and longer, sometime feels like just dead. THIS IS A FATAL DEFECT ! Hope Acer provide a fix.
customer_reviews.author: cust0101010

customer_reviews.title: Not the BEST, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. The FPS is very fast and the quality is awesome. It has features on it, that I think that I haven't even explored! There are monitors that work better or that are better but I went with this one. Works awesome! If you have a fast pc and want fast fps, this is a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Corry

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and still outdated firmware on the panels, ridclous !
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in 2019.... they still havnt updated then panels to fix the aspect ratio bug as other reviews has mentioned that has been a known issue for almost 4 years now.... turning it off and on again fixes it, it has normal ips glow, nothing outrageous that you’d notice in a dark room while watching a movie with the naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: A little blurry
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of good things about this monitor but its rather blurry. I couldn't find a setting to adjust the sharpness and I'm spoiled by my current ultrawide so I'm returning this and getting another ultrawide monitor. 144hz wasn't compelling enough to downgrade in that regard. Other than that, colors were good, no dead pixels out of the box, and felt pretty solid. The stand was quite nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Go for it. Amazon works with you if you have issues.
customer_reviews.text: I drove myself bonkers for weeks on reddit trying to figure out which 1440p 144Hz monitor to buy. This one was not on my radar. I kind of just impulse bought this as it was $200 dolars off. I love it! It came with none of the typical nightmare flaws you hear stories about with nearly every brand and model available. Will edit if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy the ASUS equivalent of this monitor, but after they screwed me on a GPU RMA I went with this one and I couldn't be happier. No dead pixels, tiny bezels, great colors, Gsync and 144hz. 1440p is just incredible. Clearly better looking than 1080p, but less expensive and easier to run than 4k, and you can run 1440p on a single high end GPU. My only tiny complaint is the OSD isn't the best, but that's very minor. All in all, I love this monitor and easily recommend it to anyone looking for a monitor for gaming or visual production.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is absolutely amazing! I have been using this monitor for almost 1month and I have been thoroughly satisfied with it's use. You need to make sure you have the proper hardware to use this monitor to it's full potential. I don't see any screen tearing or IPS glow as many people complain. Playing games on 144hz on a IPS screen with 2k resolution is just so rewarding.
customer_reviews.author: Med

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture and performance
customer_reviews.text: The image quality and performance is amazing. Picture calibration will need to be done out the box, info on how to do this is easy to find. Built in speakers are a plus, not many will use these of course but it’s great that they are there if needed. The monitor base stand and attachments is all tool free and very easy to attach, feels nice and sturdy. Only complaint would be the menu controls l, they are just not user friendly and a bit of a task to navigate but not big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Obviously I turned the brightness down because out of the box its at like 80 percent
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried about the IPS glow being excessive but in all honesty its not noticeable at all. Obviously I turned the brightness down because out of the box its at like 80 percent. It has minor black light bleed on the left hand side but the only time you see it is on start up/completely black screens. For everyday use you will never notice it unless you're looking for it. This 144hz IPS monitor is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value, didn't know what I was missing with cheap monitors
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is great, gsync is great, price is hella right. Only issues are that sometimes on Zoom the screen might flicker some while on a zoom call (while overclocking) and I've noticed that sometimes a small tear occurs in the screen, but that's fixed by turning the monitor off and on again.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Francis

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor(Predator XB271HU) no problems
customer_reviews.text: Overall wonderful I had no issues was with this monitor. Have been using it for awhile. The only small complaint is with any other IPS. The backlight bleed is a bit rough and noticeable in a dark room. However, not really a problem in a well lit environment even on darker images.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon McC

customer_reviews.title: Great picture.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now, and even though it’s a few years old, but it’s still such a great monitor. Super sturdy stand. Full tilt and rotation. 1440 is where it’s at for gaming. 4K 144htz is just still too big a price jump up, and you really need a serious pc to run 4K at a high frame rate. Great for editing as well. Cons: controls take a minute to figure out. Only one dp and one hdmi.
customer_reviews.author: AudioVideoDisco

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, but not worth $700
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor a couple years ago because I had just dealt with the Dell Gaming S2417DG. It was $400 and had the same specs, but it had horrible banding and gradient issues that nothing would fix, even the replacement was just as bad. So I was annoyed and in a hurry to get a better monitor and just bought this one for $700. It's a great monitor minus the usual IPS bleeding, but you can't really do much about that. Just make sure you get it at a decent discount, or look around for other monitors with the same specs at a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Court

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Monitor. Cheaper and the same, if not better than Asus.
customer_reviews.text: I researched monitors like crazy. All negative reviews here aren't recent. Acer has defaulted their monitor settings to where they should be for brightness, color, etc so you don't need to mess with them to get the perfect ratio. When I purchased this, it was $100 cheaper than the Asus for the same thing. IPS, 165hz (overclocked), and 1440p is more than enough and perfect for a gamer that isn't going competitive but wants a beautiful graphics experience with good gameplay. I looked up TN, 240hz, and 1ms, but unless you have bionic eyes this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent panel with some color adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Smooth 144hz experience plus the 1440p is sweet spot never gonna back to my 60 non gsync monitor. Its the same panel manufacturer as the Asus PG279Q but each company have different color calibration and design, The Acer's price is lower and the color calibration out the box has yellow tint, you can fix it by changing some settings you can search on google, the buttons is hard to navigate.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this one for pc gaming (DP), I would double check the hdmi because I believe it’s 1.4 (not 100% sure) and that won’t be able to hit 1440 affects some PCs and console. It is a little more bright than I’m use to but the picture quality is amazing! Quick and easy to install, the presets are better than good, I didn’t change much to find a good fit for myself.
customer_reviews.author: VICTOR DORANTES

customer_reviews.title: Took a risk, and I got a GOOD one!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this monitor brand new, no dead pixels, no issues so far. Box still in GREAT condition after shipment. Overclocked it to 165hz soon as I hooked it up, G-Sync was active already. Works PERFECT! I was considering the Asus ROG Swift IPS, but I took a risk with all of the negative reviews that this monitor came with. I'll tell you take the risk! I'm super happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ShineGlizzy

customer_reviews.title: Returned item - Screen light flickered
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't return this item because of it's beautiful construction and I was happy to have a new screen, BUT the screen constantly flickered on brighter colors, had ghosting issues that I could not fix by myself, so I returned this item after 2 weeks of having it. I ended up buying the ASUS ROG PG279Q 27" which has been a much more reliable purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: branden

customer_reviews.title: Almost owned for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The problems i've had are minor. Sometimes the display will blink when going into fullscreen videos, sometimes the screen will tear down the middle too. I think I've fixed this by OCing the monitor to 165hz. Over all this monitor was worth the money. Still going strong 2 years later!
customer_reviews.author: boahs

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: 1440p,IPS and 165hz with Gsync. Come on and add to cart already. After trying out 4k, HDR, Full HD, TN or VA, 240hz and curved panels I will tell you this is the one. Runs like butter, great color and sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ross

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Searched for days for a monitor for my Xbox one x, I’m completely satisfied with my purchase high quality for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Gartside

customer_reviews.title: Faulty screen on the first order... We'll see about the replacement
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this monitor. However, I turned it on and it had horrible ghosting, and what seemed to be "burn in". Where a transparent version of whatever I have open doesnt actually close when closing the application. It was awful. There was also constant flickering that I could not get rid of. At first I thought it was GPU related but I swapped GPU and also reinstalled drivers. The problem persisted. Very disappointing so far, hopefully the replacement I get works out.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: The best 1440P Gsync IPS monitor on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand TNS panels and their washed out colors. If you want an IPS monitor that supports Gsync, 144hz and low latency this is the model for you. Great colors. Great viewing angle. Minimal IPS bleed. The stand is sturdy and one of the best I've seen on a monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin T Allen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much a perfect monitor for gaming!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! I've heard horror stories of this and the Asus monitor for bleeding and dead pixels. I can honest say this monitor is just 1 tiny little pixel short of perfect. Awesome. Gaming is so smooth. I have a 1080 and this monitor. Getting 99fps and no tearing, Great purchase. Came quickly and exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor
customer_reviews.text: First off this monitor is quite good. It is very heavy so if you have your own mount check the weight limit. G-Sync does work and is beautiful. However G-Sync is difficult to get working and windows constantly changes my monitor settings around. This are not points against this monitor thought
customer_reviews.author: Austin Yount

customer_reviews.title: 1440p, no dead pixels, constant 120fps. Fam, pls.
customer_reviews.text: Solid monitor. NO problems, I have a ASUS ROG 27" (this monitor's competitor) and i like them both equally. I use one for work and one for home. The settings are actually quite nice, and the colors are great, providing wonderful depth. If you're running a gtx 1080, this monitor will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Looks great! Love the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence for a long time, but it's totally worth it to upgrade. The quality vs a normal 1080p monitor is noticeable in almost everything, not limited to gaming (which is awesome). Definitely need a decent graphics card. I paired it with a RTX 2070
customer_reviews.author: Seth Helm-Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor with many bugs.
customer_reviews.text: It’s true after about an hour or more there is a split in the middle of the screen and there is also a mirror image on the side of the screen that mimicked the other side. Just do a power cycle and you’ll be set
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Navarrete

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is great. Only issue I've had with it is an occasional color strip bug on the right side which instantly fixes when you turn off and on the power. Wish the control buttons were silent though, it's quite noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor
customer_reviews.text: Best monitor I've owned so far.. but to be fair it's my first pricy monitor that i've ever boughten but it's much better than i thought. Great for all kinds of games and i feel like they made Fps much more enjoyable and way easier on my eyes than my old monitor which was sadly 60 hz
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Top Dollar for Top Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for and this Monitor comes with all the bells and whistles, especially for gaming. IPS and G-sync are phenomenal. Don't be dissuaded by the stand, It is metal material and a beautiful sleek red.
customer_reviews.author: JMB

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Occasionally, this monitor will have a strange screen tear where there are a few pixels missing in a vertical line in a random position on the monitor. This is always fixed by turning it off, then on again. I assume it has something to do with the G-Sync. Other than that minor issue, this monitor functions wonderfully. The IPS display is crisp and clear, the colors are fantastic, and videos and video games have never looked better than in 144hz! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Yust

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd XB271-HU
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the lightning deal. The price is so nice and I set up a double-screen for my pc. It has IPS, 144-165hz refresh rate, 4ms(best in the 1st generation IPS screen), 8-bit color(enough for gaming use). Good one!
customer_reviews.author: Hong Cao

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is gorgeous, once you have changed the stock colors. Google the model name and you can find color settings that really take it to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if your pc can handle 1440p
customer_reviews.text: Its a really great monitor, but I would only recommend this monitor if you have a beefy computer. You can always get a 1080p 144hrz monitor and be good but the 1440p is just for making your games look better. But the 1440p comes with a price of fps, if your system cant handle it then dont get it. I have a r7 2700x paired with a 3200mhz flare x 16gb and a gtx 1080ti and it runs perfect wouldnt trade the monitor for anything. But thats only because my pc is a beast!!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I had a 24 inch 1440 144hz monitor and upgraded to a ultra wide 34 inch last week. I really was disappointed with the lose of performance going to the 34 inch. I decided to return the ultra wide and try out this monitor. This monitor is a sweet spot between with size and the performance. Overall very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I had the acer z35 2560x1080 ultrawide and switched to this one for mainly streaming purposes. I've had no issues with ghosting and the colors are great on it. Great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Struggled to find the right monitor for my setup, especially when I kept reading that IPS monitors were having back-bleeding issues. I've ad this monitor for a few months now and I run it alongside an RTX 2080 overclocked -- no issues, g-sync seems to work as intended, the picture is bright and beautiful, albeit you may have to adjust some of the picture settings depending on the games you are playing or personal preferences. All in all, would definitely purchase a second one if I decided to go down the dualed out route.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cooper

customer_reviews.title: I love this monitor and would never part with it
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this from a 20 inch 1080p I had for about 7 years. Paired along with a GTX1070 Ti, this monitor brought tears to my eyes with the difference in gaming. I love this monitor and would never part with it! First time I've tried a monitor with G-sync, what a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this back in August. It first started having lines in its screen and then completely failed yesterday. The display stopped working and Acer wants me to pay to ship it to their repair center even if it’s under warranty! Their repair center is in in Texas!
customer_reviews.author: Der Adler des Mondes
